title: Collection of classical music on ultra audiophile Pope Music lab
description:
â€œThe PopeMusic Dynamic Fidelity process is about the art of listening; not just a list of impressive equipment nor some snobby approach to the recording arts. It is a pledge to you our customers to always seek out the best process, the best equipment, to strive for that â€˜Holy Grailâ€™ of audio reproduction: transparency, realism, sound staging and dynamic range in order to bring the listener to as close as possible to the original performance. At Pope Music we strive for the â€˜Goosefleshâ€™ effect. It is a never ending quest that will constantly change and evolve with the state-of-the-art.â€

These disks are all recorded with two B&K Omnidirectional microphones using Mark Levinson designed Cello custom microphone preamplifiers, Apogee AD1000 A/D converter, a Nagra D 4-track open reel recorder and Cello Strings cabling. Monitoring was done using the Cello Encore Line preamp, the Cello Audio Palette tone eq system, a Cello Duet350 power amplifier and Cello Premiere speakers. 

The material is: 

PM 1007-2
Alfred Schnittke (The Russian Symphony Orchestra conducted by Mark Gorenstein)-The Gogol Suite
Tikhon Khrennikov-Love for Love

PMG2006-2 (Gold Disk) [Farewell]
The Russian Symphony Orchestra (Mark Gorenstein, conductor)
Tchaikovsky-Symphony #6 in B-minor
- Francesca Da Rimini, Op. 32 (Symphonic Fantasy)

PMG2009-2 (Gold Disk) [Redemption)
The Russian Symphony Orchestra (Mark Gorenstein, conductor)
Shostakovich-Symphony No. 5 in D-minor, op. 47
-Chamber Symphony for String Orchestra, op. 110a

PM1019-2
The Russian Symphony Orchestra (Mark Gorenstein, conductor)
Scriabin-Symphony #2, Op. 29

PM2002-2 [Unlikely Silhouettes]
The State Symphony Orchestra (Mark Gorenstein, conductor)
Shchedrin-Carmen Ballet for Strings and Percussion (based on Bizet)
Shostakovich-Bolt (Op. 27a)

PM 1004-2 [Entangled Devotions]
Beethoven (The Russian Symphony Orchestra; Naum Starkman-Piano)
Concerto for Piano and Orchestra No. 5 in E-flat major â€˜Emperorâ€™. 
Piano Sonata No. 14 in C# minor, op. 27 no. 2 â€˜Moonlightâ€™. 

PM1005-2
Lori Lieberman-Home of Whispers
Although this is not classical music, Lori Lieberman is a sensitive folk composer/singer-she wrote Roberta Flackâ€™s â€˜Killing Me Softlyâ€™ for instance. The recording chain is the same as the above classical music CDs, and the sonic quality is sheer perfection. You will be initially drawn to the audio quality, but stay for the music
